data.title: TD told to provide details of cash from developer
data.meta_description: FIANNA FÁIL Deputy GV Wright was ordered by the Mahon Planning Tribunal yesterday to provide details of payments, or political donations, received from developer Robert White.
data.text:
Giving evidence yesterday, Mr Wright said he was impressed by Mr White’s plans and had supported them because Swords needed houses and a hotel.

He described how Mr White telephoned his constituency office in Malahide and the two men met there. As they discussed the venture, Mr Wright recommended Mr White should see the local councillors for the Swords area as well as the senior planners.

Mr Wright suggested Mr White make direct contact, through his architects, with the planning officials.

The Dublin North TD said yesterday there would have been general discussions among the Fianna Fáil group of councillors about the project.

“It was a major development and I certainly would have made the group aware of my feelings for the development,” he told tribunal lawyer Pat Quinn SC.

Asked about his relationship with former political lobbyist Frank Dunlop, Mr Wright said that at that stage, Mr Dunlop had a very successful public relations company.

In previous evidence, it was stated Mr Dunlop was hired by Mr White to act in a lobbying /PR capacity.

Last week, Mr Dunlop, a former Fianna Fáil Government press secretary, admitted he was wrong when he said he paid a £1,000 bribe to Mr Wright in relation to the project.

Yesterday, Mr Wright acknowledged Mr Dunlop’s admission.

In his own statement to the tribunal, Mr Wright said he had received no payment or political donation from Mr Dunlop in respect of the Duff lands project.

Mr Dunlop is due to return to give evidence to the tribunal tomorrow.
